name: Quantico
description:
Quantico is a new type of financial service for startups and entrepreneurs. We provide all the benefits of in-house finance teams, without the cost or effort of hiring.  At the core of our service is a guarantee to provide a fixed number of days a month of working directly in our clients’ offices.  Unlike outsourced accountants, this enables us to work collaboratively across the business and to take work off the founders’ plates, without having to agree to separate scopes of work.

We’re a decentralised firm, which means that all of our bookkeepers and the majority of our Accountants and Finance Directors are remote freelancers. Our clients come to us because they need access to a range of skill-sets, able to start almost immediately.

team.bioHtml: Co-founder at Quantico. Worked at Receipt Bank, Rotageek and various other tech startups in finance and operational roles. London School of Economics graduate.

jobs.title: Finance Business Partner
jobs.description:
ABOUT YOU 

We’re looking for recently qualified accountants from top tier firms and with excellent academic credentials. 

A demonstrated interest in fast-growing businesses and entrepreneurship is essential.

You need to be comfortable working with entrepreneurs and different functional teams in their businesses.  You also need to know how to communicate financial concepts to different parts of the organisation and be able to support them when needed. You must be diplomatic but also know how to fight your corner when appropriate.

You’ll be supported by experienced engagement leaders, a peer group network and a range of experts, so you don’t need to know all the answers.  However, you do need to be confident in asking for help when you need it.  The role is not appropriate to anyone looking for constant close supervision.


THE ROLE

- Act as the primary point of contact between our firm and our clients

- The role will be based 80% at client offices, where you will become an embedded part of the organisation you’re working with 

- The other 20% of the time is allocated to training, development and peer learning, based at our offices.

- You’ll be expected to take the lead in following processes designed by senior colleagues, and making suggestions for improvements as required.

- You won’t be expected to undertake transaction processing, but you will need to manage, coordinate and review the transactional work performed by our remote teams

- You’ll be expected to identify risk areas across law, tax and finance and flag up where appropriate.

- Undertake ad-hoc analysis and forecasting as directed by clients


BENEFITS

- Get exposure to a number of the fastest growing companies in London, building up a decade’s worth of CV experience in a fraction of the time. 

- Work across a number of industries and business models quickly before evaluating an area for specialisation

- The freedom to work directly for entrepreneurs, building finance teams from scratch

- Support from a team of experienced startup accountants and specialists available whenever you need it 

- The opportunity to help shape a rapidly growing entrepreneurial business and to accelerate your career as it grows

- Salary benchmarked to the newly qualified salary offered by the Big 4. 

- Share options after one year.

jobs.title: Senior Finance Business Partner
jobs.description:
ABOUT YOU

We’re looking for ambitious accountants with at least two years of experience post qualification, who ideally trained with a top firm and have an excellent academic background.

Experience in working with fast-growing organisations, ideally in a Head of Finance or equivalent role, is essential. 

You need to be comfortable working with entrepreneurs and different functional teams in their businesses.  You need to know how to communicate financial concepts to different parts of the organisation and be able to support them when needed. 

We’re looking for candidates who are diplomatic but also know how to fight their corner when appropriate. 

You’ll be responsible for onboarding new clients, and supporting junior colleagues as they take over management of our clients’ finance functions.  

You’ll be supported by a peer group network and a range of experts, so you don’t need to know all the answers.  However, you do need to be confident in asking for help when you need it.  The role is not appropriate to anyone looking for constant close supervision. 

THE ROLE

Act as the primary point of contact between our firm and our clients
A significant part of your time will be based at client offices, where you will become an embedded part of the organisation you’re working with.
You’ll spend a lot of time working directly with new clients, identifying problems with their current systems and implementing changes.
Later you’ll step back to manage other team members as they gradually take over.
You won’t be expected to undertake transaction processing, but you will need to manage, coordinate and review the transactional work performed by our remote teams.
Over time you’ll be expected to take on more CFO roles with clients, chairing financial strategy workshops and attending board meetings.
You’ll be expected to identify risk areas across law, tax and finance and flag up where appropriate.
Undertake ad-hoc analysis and forecasting as required.
